captions.text: Why do I have body parts I don't need?
Why do I have wisdom teeth if they just need to be taken out
in prehistoric times our jaws were larger
and able to accommodate all 32 teeth our diet consisted of tougher foods like
roots and raw meat
so we needed the extra teeth to grind it down as we evolved
our brains became larger and our jaws became smaller
leaving no room for the extra molars
why do I have a Talebone? the tailbone
is a set of 3-5 vertebrae at the end of our backbones
our ancestors used to have tails but as they evolved
to walk upright their tails became unnecessary
and they eventually evolved without them. humans still have a tail during the
first trimester of pregnancy
but later in development the tail is dissolved by white blood cells
leaving the tailbone behind. did you know you have a third eyelid?`
the small patch of skin in the inner corner of our eyelids
is the remnant have a third eyelid, birds and reptiles
use their third eyelids to perform a lateral blink
to clean their cornea, humans may have at one-point been able to use their third
eyelid
but today the organ is reduced to a fold of skin
what questions do you have about your body?

title: Why Do I Have Useless Body Parts?!

comments.author: Aaron Diaz

comments.text:
I remember my last wisdom teeth surgery. First it was the top two growing 
out when I was 15, and I let them grow completely out at an angle. They 
never hurt or caused me any problems and never poked the inside of my 
mouth, so when they were taken out surgically, I felt no pain (I was so 
glad! I began to eat solid food two days later). Now my bottom teeth are 
peeking out, and I guess I just wanted to share this because I'm a little 
proud of keeping some ancestral characteristics xP Also, the third eyelid 
would be super cool to have~﻿

comments.author: BlueRibbon Banditt

comments.text:
I look at all these comments and laugh. I laugh really hard. It's either 
religion against atheists, or a logical person trying to stop all the 
flame. I don't hate religion, I don't hate atheists. I am religious, but I 
still do believe in evolution and science. It'd be absolutely crazy for me 
to throw all of that down the trash bin. Why can't religious people believe 
in evolution? Someone give me some hard evidence into why not? Anyways, 
some of these arguments are absolutely ridiculous. Atheist claim that 
Christians don't have any proof that God exists. Sure, Christians can't 
prove He exists, it's in our faith. Some Christians will be crazy and 
condemn anyone who doesn't believe to hell. Who knows if we are correct? 
It's our faith, who cares what we believe?

I also have a questions for you atheists.

Can you give me proof that he doesn't exist? Where is the proof that out 
there, a higher omnipotent being can't exist? Think about that before some 
judgemental (not all of you, I know) atheist responds.

Yes, both sides has some crazies, but that doesn't give us an excuse to rat 
on the other. We're all human here. Don't go hating on each other because 
of what we believe in.﻿

A scientific theory is a synonym for the word "fact". It's like a

theory is not. A good example: life on earth is made up of cell(s). This is 
titled "the cell theory".
